champ.champInfo:
Competitions are coordinated by the Department of Youth and Sports of the KMR. The organization of the competition is entrusted to the NGO "Sports Club Kyokushin Karate-do "Busin-kan". Direct preparation and technical conduct of the competition is carried out by the management of the NGO "Sports Club of Kyokushin Karate-do "Busin-kan" and the panel of judges. Chief judge of the competition: President of the NGO "Sports Club Kyokushin Karate-do "Busin-kan" R.V. Kashira 3dan. Supreme observer of the competition: national representative of the Kyokushin-kan Karate-do international organization in Ukraine Shikhan A.O. Shchygolev 5dan.

Competitions are held according to the rules established and approved by the International Organization "Kyokushin-kan International" and according to the Rules approved by the Ministry of Family, Youth and Sports of Ukraine for 2014. Competitions in the "kata" section are held (among men and among women) - 1/4 finals, final. Competitions in the "kumite" section are held according to the Olympic system with elimination after defeat. If an athlete does not appear on the mat after the announcement of his name within 30 seconds, the athlete is considered defeated. Athletes who were disqualified during the competition do not take part in the following matches. Athletes whose actual weight does not correspond to the weight category in the application are defeated and do not take part in the next matches. In case of disputes regarding the results of matches, the final decision is made by the chief judge of the competition. The organizers have the right to change (add or combine) weight categories if there is a large number of registered participants or if their number is insufficient.

The main judge of the competition is Roman Kashira (3rd Dan).


The competition is held on May 13, 2023


Competition program:

  • 07.30 - 08.30: preparation of the room
  • 08.30 – 09.30: registration of participants, mandate and medical commission, weighing
  • 09.30 - 09.45: judges meeting
  • 09.45 - 10.00: welcome speech, opening of the competition
  • 10.00 - 13.00: tatami A/ qualifying and final round of "kata" performances
  • 10.00 - 13.00: tatami B, C/ qualifying matches
  • 1:00 p.m. – 1:30 p.m.: awarding of winners in the "kata" section, technical break, interview for media representatives
  • 1:30 p.m. – 5:00 p.m.: mats A, B, C/ semi-final and final matches
  • 17.00 - 18.00: awarding of winners and closing of the competition

Section of KATA competitions:

  • U7: first round - Taikyoku sono ichi, second round - Taikyoku sono san.
    • U9:
    • beginners (0-9 kyu): first round – Taikyoku sono ichi, second round – Taikyoku sono san
    • experienced: first round – Taikyoku sono san, second round – Pinan sono ichi
    U11:
    • beginners (0-9 kyu): first round – Taikyoku sono san, second round – Pinan sono ichi
    • experienced: first round – Pinan sono ni, second round – Pinan sono san
    U13:
    • beginners (0-9 kyu): first round – Taikyoku sono san, second round – Pinan sono ichi
    • experienced: first round – Pinan sono san, second round – Pinan sono gou
    U15:
    • beginners (0-9 kyu): first round – Taikyoku sono san, second round – Pinan sono ichi
    • experienced: first round – Pinan sono gou, second round – Hexai Dai, Hexai Sho
  • U17:
    • beginners (0-9 kyu): first round – Taikyoku sono san, second round – Pinan sono ichi
    • experienced: first round - Hexai Dai, second round - Hexai Sho, Saikha, Seientin
  • U18+:
    • beginners (0-9 kyu): first round – Taikyoku sono san, second round – Pinan sono ichi
    • experienced: first circle – Heksai Sho, second circle – Saiha, Seientin, Kanku, Sepai, Haryu, Susyho

After the first round, there are 5 athletes (the number of participants is more than 8 people) or 4 athletes (the number of participants is less than 8 people) who scored higher points and enter the second round. In the second round, there are three winners (1st, 2nd, 3rd place). Starting score in the 1st round – 6 points, in the 2nd – 7 points.WARNING! In the "kata" section of the "novice" category (0-9 kyu) during the performance, the etiquette of exiting the tatami, voicing the name of the kata, the preliminary entrance to the "yoi" stand, and also missing the mark - "disqualification" are not evaluated. At their own request, "newbies" can participate in the "experienced" category.

Men's categories (KUMITE):

  • children U7: -20.0 -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 35.0+
  • children U9: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 40.0+
  • children U11: -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 45.0+
  • boys U13: -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 50.0+
  • boys U15: -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 60.0+
  • boys U17: -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 -70.0 70.0+
  • youth U20: -65.0 -70.0 -80.0 -90.0 90.0+
  • adults U35: -65.0 -70.0 -80.0 -90.0 90.0+

Women's categories (KUMITE):

  • children U7: -20.0 -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 35.0+
  • children U9: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 40.0+
  • children U11: -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 45.0+
  • girls U13: -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 50.0+
  • girls U15: -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 55.0+
  • junior girls U17: -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 60.0+
  • youth U20: -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 65.0+
  • adults U35: -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 -70.0 70.0+

If possible, a separate category will be formed for participants of the "kumite" section with qualifications up to 9-kyu (inclusive).

Match time

"Kumite" competition section. In this section of the competition, all participants, regardless of qualification level, perform together.

  • U7: qualifying matches - 1.0 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.0 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U9: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U11: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.0 min.+ weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • U13: qualifying matches - 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. Semi-final/final: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2.5 kg)
  • U15: qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2.5 kg)
  • U17: qualifying matches - 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. + weighing + 2.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2.5 kg)
  • U20: Qualifying matches - 3.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 3.0 min. + 2.0 min. + 2 min. + weighing + 2 min. (The difference in weight is 3 kg)
  • U35: Qualifying matches - 3.0 min. + 2.0 min. Semi-final/final: 3.0 min. + 2.0 min. + 2 min. + weighing + 2 min. (The difference in weight is 3 kg)
